alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 8:12PM CDT until May 10 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Fulton, Horton... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 45.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs at the gage site. Low lying areas along Route D near Stotesbury flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 41.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday was 41.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 44.0 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 44.0 feet on 04/20/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening at 815 PM CDT.
